text.tspan: Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easy
to administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.
Cockpit was originally created by RED HAT
Cockpit was originally created by RED HAT

flowRoot.flowPara: Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easyto administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.
Easy to use and perfect for new sysadmins
Won't interfere with your existing CLI-tools
Cockpit is a server manager that makes it easyto administer your GNU/Linux servers via a web browser.

text.tspan: File a bug in the issue tracker
Project IRC channel is #Cockpit on Freenode.net

flowRoot.flowPara: You can monitor and administer several servers at the same time. Just add it with a single click and your machine will make sure look out for it's buddies.
Cockpit is perfect for new sysadmins, allowing them to easy do simple tasks such as storage administration, inspecting journals and start and stop services.

Jumping between the terminal and the web tool is no problem. A service started via Cockpit can be stopped via the terminal. Likewise, if there error in the terminal, it can be seen in the web interfaces journal.
Cockpit is free software and released under the LGPL
